sec.p: Herring is an important prey item for numerous predators, particularly marine mammals, within the Northeast Pacific food web (Figs 2â€“ 4), though its ecosystem role may not be as crucial as that of sardine and anchovy in upwelling ecosystems [ 1, 46, 63]. However, a recent study based on a set of energy-balanced Ecopath models suggests that Pacific herring may be more important as prey than mass-balanced models indicated [ 64], corroborating several studies [ 65, 66] which place adult herring among the most energy-rich forage fish in the subarctic North Pacific.
